name: ARMSTRONG DIGITAL SERVICES, INC., Appellant v. COMMONWEALTH of Pennsylvania, Appellee
name_abbreviation: Armstrong Digital Services, Inc. v. Commonwealth

pin_cites.parenthetical: "[I]f an attorney entrusts the responsibilities of preparing and filing legal papers with his staff, the attorney has a continuing responsibility to see that these duties are properly and timely performed[.]"

parties: ARMSTRONG DIGITAL SERVICES, INC., Appellant v. COMMONWEALTH of Pennsylvania, Appellee.

opinions.text:
ORDER
PER CURIAM.
AND NOW, this 22nd day of January, 2013, the Orders of the Commonwealth Court are AFFIRMED. See Stanton v. Department of Transportation, Bureau of Driver Licensing, 154 Pa.Cmwlth. 350, 623 A.2d 925, 927 (1993) (“[I]f an attorney entrusts the responsibilities of preparing and filing legal papers with his staff, the attorney has a continuing responsibility to see that these duties are properly and timely performed[.]”).
opinions.author: PER CURIAM.

casebody.head_matter:
61 A.3d 187
ARMSTRONG DIGITAL SERVICES, INC., Appellant v. COMMONWEALTH of Pennsylvania, Appellee.
Supreme Court of Pennsylvania.
Jan. 22, 2013.
